description: Amazon Linux 2 CIS Benchmark - Section 1.1.2 Configure Filesystem Partitions

controls.title: Ensure /tmp is a separate partition
controls.description: The /tmp directory is a world-writable directory used for temporary file storage. Separating /tmp from the root filesystem ensures that processes cannot exhaust all available space on the root filesystem.
controls.remediation: Create a separate partition for /tmp and add it to /etc/fstab

controls.title: Ensure nodev option set on /tmp partition
controls.description: The nodev mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain special devices. This prevents device files from being created in /tmp.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nodev to the mount options for /tmp

controls.title: Ensure nosuid option set on /tmp partition
controls.description: The nosuid mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain setuid files. This prevents setuid files from being executed from /tmp.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add nosuid to the mount options for /tmp

controls.title: Ensure noexec option set on /tmp partition
controls.description: The noexec mount option specifies that the filesystem cannot contain executable binaries. This prevents executable files from being executed from /tmp.
controls.remediation: Edit /etc/fstab and add noexec to the mount options for /tmp
